issue.title: What is the structure of the final?

content.raw:
Yeah!  That's exactly what I have now, ROS on both sides.  My communications protocol packs up ROS packets (and zips them to save bandwidth) then sends it over to where I unpack it and re-publish it on the other side.  Of course, you don't have to run ROS on the OCU side, it just makes it feel more consistent.  

So I have two different ROS instances that are communicating with each other over the interwebs.
content.html:
Yeah! That's exactly what I have now, ROS on both sides. My communications protocol packs up ROS packets (and zips them to save bandwidth) then sends it over to where I unpack it and re-publish it on the other side. Of course, you don't have to run ROS on the OCU side, it just makes it feel more consistent.

So I have two different ROS instances that are communicating with each other over the interwebs.
